name: (3beta,4alpha,8alpha,17xi,20xi)-4,14-dimethyl-8,9-epoxycholestan-3-ol
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-1934
Reason: 4,14-dimethyl-8,9-epoxycholestan-3-ol is a derivative of cholestanol, which has a melting point around 148-150°C. The presence of the epoxide group (–O) in the 8,9-position increases the molecular weight and size, which generally raises the melting point. However, the epoxide group also introduces a rigid ring structure, which can affect the crystal lattice stability and lower the melting point. The hydroxyl group (-OH) in the 3-position can participate in hydrogen bonding, which can further lower the melting point. Taking the effect of the epoxide group and the hydroxyl group into consideration, we can predict a net increase due to molecular size but a more significant decrease due to additional hydrogen bonding and the rigid ring structure. The net effect should thus be a slightly decreased melting point compared to cholestanol.
